body:
> Hyper key for the uninitiated is actually a simultaneous key press event for the actual modifier keys Command|Shift|Control|Option

That is **not** what a hyper key is.

> For meanwhile, I've downgrade back to alacritty 0.13.2.

So can you confirm that the downgrade fixed the issue?

> > For meanwhile, I've downgrade back to alacritty 0.13.2.
> 
> So can you confirm that the downgrade fixed the issue?

Yes, I can confirm downgrading fixed the issue. Furthermore, I have also discovered a way to reliably trigger a crash and have logs for both 0.13.2 and 0.14.0 that shows version 0.13.2 continues to operate just fine after the trigger while 0.14.0 crashes.

To replicate perform the following input sequence: 
- hyper-e
- release hyper while still holding e

A crash should follow. For debug purposes I disabled my config and performed this on a default initialization of alacritty, so no keyboard bindings for a `Command|Shift|Control|Option` sequence are present. There are other crashing triggers involving the hyper key, this sequence was just chosen for replication purposes.

body:
Yesterday my computer was on MacOS 14.x, alacritty would crash; Today, after upgrading to MacOS 15.1, alacritty still has crash issues. 
The crash only occurred after Alaclitty was upgraded to version 0.14, and there was no crash in version 0.13.

Press the Shift/Tab key to switch to the Chinese input method, after entering a piece of content, it is easy to crash when you cut the Tab key again to switch back to English. I've had four crashes in a day today.

Hmm, weird that this differs between Winit 0.29 and 0.30, since the code paths for this haven't really changed (from what I can tell).

Also odd that the method [`charactersIgnoringModifiers`](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nsevent/1524605-charactersignoringmodifiers?language=objc) (which is the one crashing) is documented to throw this error on "non-key events", but we call [`keyCode`](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nsevent/1534513-keycode?language=objc) earlier which has the same documented caveat! And the event originates in [`flagsChanged:`](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nsresponder/1527647-flagschanged?language=objc), which literally says "Informs the receiver that the user has pressed or released a modifier key" (so I cannot imagine how the event could _not_ be a key event?).

I'll try to reproduce this myself, but in the meantime if someone could check the value of `dbg!(unsafe { event.r#type() })` [inside `create_key_event`](https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/blob/v0.30.5/src/platform_impl/macos/event.rs#L95), that'd be nice!
The issue was resolved after upgrading to macOS 15.1.1 (24B91) (at least for me), I suggest everyone try upgrading.

And are you all using BetterTouchTool (because I didn't test with that)?

issue.title: Crash when open a top window (including input methods)
issue.body:
when I trigger a top window ([Raycast](https://www.raycast.com/), ChatGPT chat box or Chinese Input methods), the Window will be crash. (Triggered only at sometime, not every time.)


![hi](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b42cf55-4609-40b7-b5c5-762143bb64d7)

### System

OS: MacOS 15.1.1 (24B91)
Version: alacritty 0.14.0 (22a4475)

body:
Looking at the diff between Winit v0.29.15 and v0.30.5, the only possible offenders that I could see are (as in, these changed _something_ in the code-path):
- https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/pull/3361
- https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/pull/3157
- https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/pull/3221

With the first being the most likely.

I still can't reproduce, but it'd be nice if someone that can could try to build Alacritty locally, see if the issue persists, and then cherry pick revert these PRs one by one, and see if the issue still persists.

> Looking at the diff between Winit v0.29.15 and v0.30.5, the only possible offenders that I could see are (as in, these changed _something_ in the code-path):
> 
> * [On macOS, report correct logical key when Ctrl or Cmd is pressedÂ rust-windowing/winit#3361](https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/pull/3361)
> * [On macOS, fix globe key triggering assertionÂ rust-windowing/winit#3157](https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/pull/3157)
> * [On macOS, fix assertion when pressing `Fn` keyÂ rust-windowing/winit#3221](https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/pull/3221)
> 
> With the first being the most likely.
> 
> I still can't reproduce, but it'd be nice if someone that can could try to build Alacritty locally, see if the issue persists, and then cherry pick revert these PRs one by one, and see if the issue still persists.

I tried compiling the latest commit of the master branch of Alacritty, but it still crashes. Then I tried reverting the first PR you mentioned, but I couldn't find the PR-related commit on the master branch of winit, so I couldn't attempt the revert.

> > I tried compiling the latest commit of the master branch of Alacritty, but it still crashes. Then I tried reverting the first PR you mentioned, but I couldn't find the PR-related commit on the master branch of winit, so I couldn't attempt the revert.
> 
> Fair. Perhaps try applying the following diffs to WInit v0.30.5:
> 
> First PR:
> 
> ```diff
> diff --git a/src/platform_impl/macos/event.rs b/src/platform_impl/macos/event.rs
> index 602ab6278..fe44a3c3b 100644
> --- a/src/platform_impl/macos/event.rs
> +++ b/src/platform_impl/macos/event.rs
> @@ -134,7 +134,6 @@ pub(crate) fn create_key_event(
>  
>          let modifiers = unsafe { ns_event.modifierFlags() };
>          let has_ctrl = modifiers.contains(NSEventModifierFlags::NSEventModifierFlagControl);
> -        let has_cmd = modifiers.contains(NSEventModifierFlags::NSEventModifierFlagCommand);
>  
>          let logical_key = match text_with_all_modifiers.as_ref() {
>              // Only checking for ctrl and cmd here, not checking for alt because we DO want to
> @@ -142,7 +141,7 @@ pub(crate) fn create_key_event(
>              // presses alt+8, the logical key should be "{"
>              // Also not checking if this is a release event because then this issue would
>              // still affect the key release.
> -            Some(text) if !has_ctrl && !has_cmd => {
> +            Some(text) if !has_ctrl => {
>                  // Character heeding both SHIFT and ALT.
>                  Key::Character(text.clone())
>              },
> ```
> 
> Second PR:
> 
> ```diff
> diff --git a/src/platform_impl/macos/view.rs b/src/platform_impl/macos/view.rs
> index 50cffcee6..2853a3402 100644
> --- a/src/platform_impl/macos/view.rs
> +++ b/src/platform_impl/macos/view.rs
> @@ -929,7 +929,7 @@ impl WinitView {
>          // later will work though, since the flags are attached to the event and contain valid
>          // information.
>          'send_event: {
> -            if is_flags_changed_event && unsafe { ns_event.keyCode() } != 0 {
> +            if is_flags_changed_event {
>                  let scancode = unsafe { ns_event.keyCode() };
>                  let physical_key = scancode_to_physicalkey(scancode as u32);
> ```
> 
> I don't think the culprit is the third PR.
> 
> (You'll have to check out both Alacritty and Winit, and use `[patch.crates-io] winit = { path = "../winit" }` or similar in Alacritty's Cargo.toml)

I just tried it, and it still crashes.
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0e1907cb-a757-4233-83ff-a9c25398e2e0)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f1a5d05b-bd6c-4d97-b451-b0aeecb5b018)
Hmm, weird, then I'm inclined to not think it's a Winit issue? (not that I know what the issue is then)

I have the same issue. I changed the key to change language to CapsLock, and when I press CapsLock and any key with it simultaneously, I have the same issue with crashing.

I tried to debug the panic and found that it occurs from calling ns_event.charactersIgnoringModifiers().

https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/blob/114512bb329ac2da78e33dcd54c3f466f34da394/src/platform_impl/macos/event.rs#L81

also i have this log:

```
[general] *** Assertion failure in -[NSEvent charactersIgnoringModifiers], NSEvent.m:2870
```

I reproduced it on MacOs 15.2 Beta (24C5089c) and MacOs 14.7.1 (23H222) with the same actions.
